metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9954 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The backtrack compilation code in the Irregex package (aka IrRegular Expressions) before 0.9.6 for Scheme allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted regular expression with a repeating pattern.

criterions.comment: chicken: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
